BSU_01360	224308.BSU01360	1.63e-297	813.0	COG0201@1|root,COG0201@2|Bacteria,1TPHB@1239|Firmicutes,4HAWH@91061|Bacilli,1ZCEG@1386|Bacillus	2|Bacteria	U	The central subunit of the protein translocation channel SecYEG. Consists of two halves formed by TMs 1-5 and 6-10. These two domains form a lateral gate at the front which open onto the bilayer between TMs 2 and 7, and are clamped together by SecE at the back. The nucleophile active site attacks the C1' of nucleotide 34 to detach the guanine base from the RNA, forming a covalent enzyme-RNA intermediate.
